whatIsCapoeira.title: What is Capoeira?
whatIsCapoeira.description: Capoeira (pronounced ka-poo-ay-da) is a martial art developed in Brazil by enslaved Africans. It is a communal game in which two opponents play each other inside a circle, formed by the other players who create rhythm for the game by clapping, singing and playing traditional instruments.
whatIsCapoeira.extendedDescription: The two "capoeiristas" play a game together using capoeira movements, camouflaging self-defense kicks with playful acrobatics and dance-like moves, spontaneously creating a strategy to fool the other player and perhaps catch them off guard. At the same time, the two players work together to build a beautiful, harmonic and naturally-flowing game.
highlights: Afro-Brazilian martial art with over 500 years of history
Combines self-defense, acrobatics, dance, and music
Full-body workout for all fitness levels
Learn traditional instruments and Portuguese songs
Join a global community of practitioners

whyAbada.title: Why ABADÁ-Capoeira?
whyAbada.subtitle: Part of a Global Family
whyAbada.description: ABADÁ-Capoeira was founded in 1988 by Mestre Camisa in Rio de Janeiro. The name stands for Associação Brasileira de Apoio e Desenvolvimento da Arte-Capoeira (The Brazilian Association for the Support and Development of the Art of Capoeira).
